hint: Focus on improving filter performance by pushing conditions earlier, decorrelating subqueries, and converting implicit joins to explicit joins to give the optimizer better selectivity estimates.
Isolate the complex date filter chain into a reusable CTE, pre-filter all dimension tables (date_dim, item) with materialized CTEs, and restructure joins to reduce repeated computation.

Pre-filter and materialize dimension and fact tables into a single base CTE, then compute all three return aggregations (store, catalog, web) in one scan using conditional aggregation, eliminating the three separate CTEs.

Transform the three separate CTEs into a UNION ALL of base returns, then use a single aggregation with FILTER clauses. Also explore replacing the multi-level date subquery with a window-based lookup or a temporal JOIN.
